Maths
Class BandMatrix

java.lang.Object
  Maths.AbstractMatrix
      Maths.BandMatrix

public class BandMatrix
extends AbstractMatrix

This implements a band Matrix with diagonales from top left to bottom right. It can be used to save memory.

Author:
sebastianzillessen

Constructor Summary
BandMatrix(AbstractMatrix m)
          creates a new BandMatrix out of an existing matrix (can sometimes be good for transformations)

          generates a new bandmatrix of the size size x size with the specified band indexes. 0 is the center diagonale from top left to bottom right.

Constructor Detail

BandMatrix

public BandMatrix(AbstractMatrix m)
creates a new BandMatrix out of an existing matrix (can sometimes be good for transformations)

Parameters:
m -

BandMatrix

public BandMatrix(int size,
                  int[] bandIndexes)
generates a new bandmatrix of the size size x size with the specified band indexes. 0 is the center diagonale from top left to bottom right. -n is the n-th diagonale below the center. +n is the n-th diagonele above the center.

Parameters:
size - size of the matrix
bandIndexes - diagonales which should be able to be set (0 is zenter)

BandMatrix

public BandMatrix(int size,
                  java.util.Set bandIndexes)
generates a new bandmatrix of the size size x size with the specified band indexes. 0 is the center diagonale from top left to bottom right. -n is the n-th diagonale below the center. +n is the n-th diagonele above the center.

Parameters:
size - size of the matrix
bandIndexes - diagonales which should be able to be set (0 is zenter)

public BandMatrix add(BandMatrix m)
Adds two matrixes element wise.

result of this + m (each coefficients will be added).

get

public double get(int row,
                  int col)
Get the entry of a element.

Specified by:
get in class AbstractMatrix
Parameters:
row - row of the matrix element.
col - col of the matrix element
Returns:
the set value in this cell. If no value was set, zero is returned. If the entry is outside of the specified bands of this matrix zero is returned as well.
Throws:
java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - if rows or cols is not in the range of this matrix

isPentadiagonale

public boolean isPentadiagonale()
Checks if a matrix is pentadiagonale (only the diagonale and the two elements next to it are set, so special form of a band matrix) A Band matrix is pentadiagonale if the bandIndexes are a subset of [-2,-1,0,1,2]

Overrides:
isPentadiagonale in class AbstractMatrix
Returns:
true if pentadiagonale

mult

public BandMatrix mult(BandMatrix m)
Multiplies to Band-Matrices in an efficient way.

If no efficient way is found it falls back to default multiplication and parses it as Band Matrix.

Parameters:
m - other band matrix
Returns:
Result of this * m as matrix multiplication
See Also:
AbstractMatrix.mult(AbstractMatrix)

parse

public static BandMatrix parse(java.lang.String s)
Parses a String to a Band Matrix. Entries have to be seperated by space, new lines represent a new row in the matrix.

Example:

s = "1 2 0 0\n"+ "0 7 8 0 \n"+ "0 0 1 1"+

Parameters:
s - space seperated matrix input (new lines for new row)
Returns:
a band matrix corresponding to s
